oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eleanor Roosevelt Talk at Highlander
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Typewritten copy of remarks by Myles Horton, May Justus, and Eleanor Roosevelt. Roosevelt visited Highlander in 1958 to speak about voting rights and voter education.

Eleanor Roosevelt visited Highlander Folk School in 1958 to deliver remarks on voting rights and voter education to a crowed of some 300 people. She had been a long-time supporter of the school donating money on numerous occasions.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roosevelt, Eleanor, 1884-1962; Horton, Myles, 1905-1990; Justus, May, 1898-1989
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Horton, Myles, 1905-1990; Roosevelt, Eleanor, 1884-1962; Communism and education; Communism--Soviet Union; Political rights
